security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for AI code generation. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands detected. The skill provides CSS coding standards and Tailwind methodology guidance.

content.user_title: Write Consistent, Maintainable CSS with Tailwind
content.value_statement: Writing CSS without standards leads to inconsistent styling, bloated stylesheets, and maintenance challenges across a codebase. This skill guides AI assistants to use Tailwind utility classes, follow design system tokens, and maintain styling consistency across all components.
actual_capabilities: Writes Tailwind utility classes in React components (.tsx, .jsx files)
Implements design system tokens for colors, spacing, and typography
Configures Tailwind theme extensions using the @theme directive
Optimizes CSS for production with tree-shaking and purging
Decides when to use framework utilities vs. custom CSS
Maintains consistent styling patterns across all components
limitations: Does not execute or validate CSS in a browser environment
Does not generate complete CSS files from design mockups
Does not debug CSS rendering issues or layout problems
Relies on existing project design tokens and Tailwind configuration

use_cases.title: React Component Styling
use_cases.description: Apply consistent Tailwind utility classes when building or editing React components in .tsx or .jsx files.

use_cases.title: Design Token Implementation
use_cases.description: Configure and extend Tailwind themes using @theme directive while maintaining design system consistency.

use_cases.title: CSS Performance Optimization
use_cases.description: Optimize CSS bundle size through proper tree-shaking, purging unused styles, and avoiding redundant framework overrides.

prompt_templates.title: Basic CSS Styling
prompt_templates.prompt: Style this React component with Tailwind utility classes. Use the design system tokens for colors and spacing.

prompt_templates.title: Responsive Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Add responsive breakpoints to this layout using Tailwind's sm:, md:, lg:, and xl: prefixes.

prompt_templates.title: Theme Configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure a Tailwind theme extension using @theme directive for custom brand colors and typography.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this CSS and identify any violations of the Tailwind methodology. Suggest improvements using utility classes instead of custom CSS.

output_examples.input: Style a card component with a title, description, and action button using Tailwind.
output: Button: bg-blue-600 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded hover:bg-blue-700 transition-colors

best_practices: Use utility classes over custom CSS whenever possible to maintain consistency and enable tree-shaking
Reference design system tokens for colors, spacing, and typography instead of hardcoded values
Group related utility classes logically and use consistent ordering across components
anti_patterns: Writing custom CSS when Tailwind utility classes would achieve the same result
Using arbitrary values like bg-[#ff0000] instead of design token colors
Overriding framework styles with !important instead of using proper utility classes

faq.question: Does this skill work with custom CSS frameworks?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on Tailwind CSS methodology but principles apply to utility-first approaches. Custom frameworks may need additional configuration.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for CSS-in-JS solutions?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill applies to any React component styling. CSS-in-JS with Tailwind syntax works with this skill.

faq.question: Does this skill validate CSS syntax?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance on coding standards. Browser validation or linters handle syntax checking.

faq.question: Is my design system information kept private?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only reads and references your project's design tokens locally. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are my styles not appearing in the output?
faq.answer: Ensure Tailwind is properly configured in your project. Check that the design token files exist and are referenced correctly.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter like Stylelint?
faq.answer: This skill guides AI-assisted coding decisions. Linters enforce rules programmatically. Both complement each other in a workflow.
